question: You are going to move out of your apartment in a English-speaking country. Your landlord is a very good person, who has assisted you a lot during your stay. Meanwhile, your friend would like to rent the flat after you. Write a letter to your landlord.In your letter,•	Let your landlord know that you will be leaving•	Thank you landlord for his/her help•	Tel him/her about your friend
text: I am writing this letter to tell you that  next month I am moving out of my current apartment.

Yesterday I received a job offer from Google for a full-time job. They are expecting me on the 1st of March. This company is accommodated in Canada, due to this I have to remove there before arranged dates.

I want to thank you for your help during my stay in this flat. You are a very kind and responsible person whom I have ever known. Especially, I want to say thank you for that day, when my electricity was switched off. I could do nothing in that situation, because I had not had the special knowledge and equipment to repair it. It could cause very big problems for me and my work, moreover, if I have not finished my work in time, I would have lost it. However, before I had started a panic, you had come and destroyed all issues. Thank you a lot for that help and for all other helps during the period, that I have been staying in this apartment. I hope we have become real friends and this relationship will be saved in the future.

In addition, I want to say, that a friend of mine wants to rent this flat after me. If you gave a positive suggestion to this offer, she would remove here immediately after me. Please let me know your suggestion about this.

error_list.error_des: It appears that you have an unnecessary comma before the dependent clause marker because. Consider removing the comma.
